t: Jeremiah 46
Judgment on Egypt
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

About*p Egypt. Concerning the army of Pharaoh Neco, king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates at Carchemish and which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:
“Prepare*pn buckler and shield, and*ld advance for battle!
Harness*ln the horses; mount,*ld O horsemen! Take*ln your stations with your helmets, polish*ld your spears, put*ld on your armor!

Why*ln have I seen it? They*ln are dismayed and*ld have turned backward. Their*ln warriors are beaten down and*ld have fled in haste; they*ln look not back— terror*ld on every side! declares*l the Lord.*s
“The*pn swift cannot flee away, nor*ld the warrior escape; in*ln the north by the river Euphrates they*ld have stumbled and fallen.
“Who*pn is this, rising like the Nile, like*ld rivers whose waters surge?
Egypt*ln rises like the Nile, like*ld rivers whose waters surge. He*ln said, ‘I will rise, I will cover the earth, I*ld will destroy cities and their inhabitants.’
Advance,*ln O horses, and*ld rage, O chariots! Let*ln the warriors go out: men*ld of Cush and Put who handle the shield, men*ld of Lud, skilled in handling the bow.

That*ln day is the day of the Lord God*s of hosts, a*ld day of vengeance, to*ld avenge himself on his foes. The*ln sword shall devour and be sated and*ld drink its fill of their blood. For*ln the Lord God*s of hosts holds a sacrifice in*ld the north country by the river Euphrates.
Go*ln up to Gilead, and take balm, O*ld virgin daughter of Egypt! In*ln vain you have used many medicines; there*ld is no healing for you.
The*ln nations have heard of your shame, and*ld the earth is full of your cry; for*ln warrior has stumbled against warrior; they*ld have both fallen together.”
The*p word that the Lord*s spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to strike the land of Egypt:
“Declare*pn in Egypt, and proclaim in Migdol; proclaim*ld in Memphis and Tahpanhes; say,*ln ‘Stand ready and be prepared, for*ld the sword shall devour around you.’
Why*ln are your mighty ones face down? They*ld do not stand because*ld the Lord*s thrust them down.
He*ln made many stumble, and they fell, and*ld they said one to another, ‘Arise,*ln and let us go back to our own people and*ld to the land of our birth, because*ld of the sword of the oppressor.’
Call*ln the name of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, ‘Noisy*ld one who lets the hour go by.’
“As*pn I live, declares the King, whose*ld name is the Lord*s of hosts, like*ln Tabor among the mountains and*ld like Carmel by the sea, shall one come.
Prepare*ln yourselves baggage for exile, O*ld inhabitants of Egypt! For*ln Memphis shall become a waste, a*ld ruin, without inhabitant.
“A*pn beautiful heifer is Egypt, but*ld a biting fly from the north has come upon her.

Even*ln her hired soldiers in her midst are*ld like fattened calves; yes,*ln they have turned and fled together; they*ld did not stand, for*ln the day of their calamity has come upon them, the*ld time of their punishment.
“She*pn makes a sound like a serpent gliding away; for*ld her enemies march in force and*ln come against her with axes like*ld those who fell trees.
They*ln shall cut down her forest, declares*l the Lord,*s though*ld it is impenetrable, because*ln they are more numerous than locusts; they*ld are without number.
The*ln daughter of Egypt shall be put to shame; she*ld shall be delivered into the hand of a people from the north.”
The*p Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel, said: “Behold, I am bringing punishment upon Amon of Thebes, and Pharaoh and Egypt and her gods and her kings, upon Pharaoh and those who trust in him.

I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their life, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his officers. Afterward Egypt shall be inhabited as in the days of old, declares the Lord.*s

“But*pn fear not, O Jacob my servant, nor*ld be dismayed, O Israel, for*ln behold, I will save you from far away, and*ld your offspring from the land of their captivity. Jacob*ln shall return and have quiet and ease, and*ld none shall make him afraid.

Fear*ln not, O Jacob my servant, declares*l the Lord,*s for*ld I am with you. I*ln will make a full end of all the nations to*ld which I have driven you, but*ld of you I will not make a full end. I*ln will discipline you in just measure, and*ld I will by no means leave you unpunished.”
